New Records: Francisco Lindor hit a grand slam in the sixth inning, breaking a tie and giving the Mets a 4-1 lead.
Edwin DÃ­az struck out Kyle Schwarber with two runners aboard to end the game, securing the Mets' victory.
Key Match Events: Francisco Lindor's grand slam in the sixth inning was a turning point and a key moment in the game.
The Mets clinched their first postseason series win at home in 24 years with this victory.
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets and Phillies were both highly anticipated in the NLDS, with the Phillies having finished six games ahead of the Mets during the regular season.
Post-Match Reflections: The Mets celebrated their first championship series win at Citi Field with a champagne-soaked clubhouse celebration.
The Phillies' early exit from the playoffs was a disappointing outcome after their strong regular season and previous World Series appearances.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets will face either the San Diego Padres or Los Angeles Dodgers in the NLCS, starting on October 13 with the Padres having a 2-1 lead in their NLDS.
